articles.title: Soccer-France players hit by colds as Argentina final looms
articles.description: The first day, Dayot stayed in his room and we brought him food and he was back with everyone the next day." France midfielder Aurelien Tchouameni (knock on hip) and Theo Hernandez (knock on knee) missed training on Friday to work indoors, FFF said. Deschamps was confident both Upamecano and Rabiot would be fit for Sunday's showdown at the Lusail Stadium.

articles.title: Best goals scored across FIFA World Cup so far
articles.description: With the 2022 FIFA World Cup coming down to its last two matches — the third-fourth place playoff and the Argentina vs France final — we take a look at some of the best goals scored across the tournament.
articles.content:
The FIFA World Cup in Qatar is nearing its end, eliciting mixed reactions from fans. While football enthusiasts are keen to know who will win the coveted trophy, they are also disappointed at having to wait four years for the next edition.

articles.title: Scaloni heads into final as the coach who made Messi and Argentina smile again
articles.description: Lionel Messi will deservedly hog the spotlight when Argentina face France in Sunday's World Cup final, yet the potential pinnacle of his glorious career could have passed him by were it not for his manager Lionel Scaloni.

articles.title: France's Deschamps on cusp of World Cup history but happy to shun limelight
articles.description: No coach has ever won the World Cup twice in the post-World War II era but France's Didier Deschamps is one victory away from entering the record books when they take on Argentina in the final on Sunday in Qatar.

articles.title: Soccer-France players hit by colds as Argentina final looms
articles.description: Centre back Dayot Upamecano and midfielder Adrien Rabiot missed Wednesday's 2-0 semi-final win over Morocco with the illness. Coach Didier Deschamps refused to panic after Wednesday's game and said they were being careful to ensure the illness did not spread.
